posts.post_content:
@Donovan\_Fabian: Sounds like you're reaching. This card is better than [Overrun](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Overrun) the same way [Primal Bellow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primal Bellow)/[Might of the Masses](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Might of the Masses) is better than [Giant Growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Giant Growth) - not strictly better, but better in almost all situations.  
  
It's not like it's hard to swing for >20 on turn 4 with this either. Turn 1:  [Elves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=205228), turn 2: [Leatherback](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=197856), turn 3: [Kozilek's Predator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=198303), turn 4: Overwhelming Stampede. And that's one of many examples, since this card rewards having either more creatures OR stronger creatures. Versatility is what makes this card so much more appealing than Overrun - if you only have a couple creatures out, as long as one has decent power (3-4) you can throw down a Giant Growth and get the essential killing power you need. That's not card disadvantage any more than throwing down that ext... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

posts.post_content: I'm sure I won't be the first to say this, but I prefer [overrun](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=overrun). Overrun is all about making your swarm of little creatures (probably 1/1 tokens) lethal. Stampede requires me to have a big creature and a lot of creatures to be effective. Not that this is a bad card.
posts.html:

That reminder text for trample looks pretty intimidating. I can just imagine a new player looking at this thing and running off scared. It's quite simple though really.

posts.post_content:
i had a couple big creatures out, my biggest being [primeval titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=primeval titan) with a [blanchwood armor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=blanchwood armor), and a bunch of small mana ramp cards  
  
played this, giving each of my creatures +20/+20 and trample. my primeval alone, after attacking was a 42/42 trample.  
  
this compared to [overrun](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=overrun) is far better if you have a creature that has more than 3 power. otherwise overrun is better, but my green deck has plenty of fatties to power this

posts.post_content:
This card saved my life one time.  
  
Opponent: Okay, I'll hit you with my [Slash Panther](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Slash Panther) which has a [Whispersilk Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whispersilk Cloak) AGAIN. You're at 5 life.  
Me: Fine. (Plays [Grave Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grave Titan).)  
Opponent: I'll hit you for 4 more. You're at 1 life.  
Me: Crud. (Draws card.) Overwhelming Stampede. All my guys get +6/+6 and trample. Game.  
  
Talk about close calls. This card is a game-winner.
posts.html:
